page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW,PURTON STOKE.
page.content: At first we thought this was just a rural area comprising{dairy farms, {grazing land }and{a small village. Little cultivation is carried out as the land is a heavy clay.The road from Purton to Cricklade runs through the centre;to the east the area is bounded by the{River Ray},and to the west by the{River Key.}Both these small rivers run into the Thames at Cricklade, but the Ray consists largely of effluent from Swindon sewage works while the Key arises from pure springs.The revival of the Swindon/Cricklade {Railway}provides a tourist attraction, while there is a little{fishing & clay {pigeon shooting}for locals.Most people must have cars as there is only one {bus}(to Wootton Bassett) each week.The village has not attracted new building or commuters,which is surprising as Thamesdown is so near.
